text: hey everyone is Sam here from sugar
spoon run and today I'll be showing you
how to make chocolate lava cakes these
molten chocolate lava cakes are for
serious chocolate lovers only if that's
you you are going to love today's recipe
to get started you'll need to pre-heat
your oven to 450 degrees Fahrenheit now
if you don't use Fahrenheit if you don't
use cups for measurement I have all of
the metric conversions in the printable
recipe below now the first ingredient
you're going to need today is 6 ounces
of a quality chocolate I like to use 60%
dark chocolate but semi-sweet will work
just as well so you can either break
these chocolate pieces by hand or you
can use a large knife to cut it you just
want the pieces to be about the same
size and then to just expedite the
melting process because we're gonna be
melting this chocolate in a minute I am
going to use my large knife and I'm just
going to just gently chop the chocolate
a little bit more this is looking pretty
good so what I'm going to do now is I'll
transfer this chocolate to a
microwave-safe medium sized bowl just
let me get all of that in there we'll
add 1/2 cup or 1 stick of unsalted
butter to our chocolate and I'm just
going to cut this into about tablespoon
sized pieces we're gonna pop this
chocolate and butter in our microwave
and we'll heat it at about 15 to 20
second intervals stirring really well in
between you just want to get the
chocolate and butter until they're both
completely melted and your mixture is
smooth it's really important when
heating your chocolate and butter
together that you don't overheat this if
you zap it in the microwave for like a
minute what you'll end up with is
chocolate that sees it's going to be
really hard to mix it's not going to
work for these lava cakes so patience is
key so this is looking really good right
now so what I like to add at this point
is a 1/2 teaspoon of instant coffee you
can skip this if you want or if you
don't have it on hand it is not going to
make your lava cakes taste like coffee
this flavor just really helps bring out
that chocolate taste like I said this is
a rich chocolate dessert we'll also add
1/4 teaspoon of salt just stir until
it's completely combined now we're going
to set this chocolate mixture aside and
you are going to need a separate Bowl
what we're going to do is
we will add two large eggs and two large
egg yolks so you need four eggs total
but you're going to discard the whites
from two of them you can save those to
make my meringue cookies if you want
I'll leave a link for that in the
description below so we'll add these to
our Bowl and we'll add 1/3 cup of
tightly packed light brown sugar now
you're going to first need to just break
up this brown sugar a little bit with
your whisk and then vigorously whisk
this mixture for about 15 seconds or
until foamy you want to make sure that
eggs and the brown sugar are nicely
combined and there shouldn't be any
clumps here once that's nicely combined
we're going to bring back our chocolate
mixture and we'll add this egg mixture
into our chocolate mixture and just stir
until it's completely combined now one
suggestion I have is you should really
be using room-temperature eggs for this
recipe it's going to make this
combination of the egg mixture and the
chocolate a lot easier the ingredients
are going to combine much better if you
don't happen to have room-temperature
eggs on hand what you can do is you can
set them in a bowl of warm water for
about 15 minutes that'll bring them to
room temperature pretty quickly
there's just one ingredient left to add
and that is a quarter cup of all-purpose
flour now what I'm going to do is I'm
going to sift this over my chocolate
mixture that way we don't have any lumps
of flour stir this together until
everything is nicely combined at this
point your batter should be smooth and
velvety and well combined so it's ready
to bake now the next thing you are going
to need is four ramekins they should be
about three and a half inches in
diameter now if you don't have ramekins
I do have instructions for making these
lava cakes in a large muffin tin I'll
include those in the printable recipe
below so what you'll need to do with
these is you'll just want to lightly
spray them with a baking spray now I'm
just spraying the bottom of each ramekin
with the baking spray and now I'm going
to use a paper towel to just kind of
work that into the bottom and up the
sides because you need the bottom and
the sides of the ramekin to be greased
now if you're using a spray make sure it
is a baking spray that has flour in it
the flour is important to keep these
lava cakes from sticking to the ramekins
if you don't have a baking spray you can
just gently grease each ramekin and
lightly flour it make sure to tap out
any extra flour and then you can add
your lava cake batter
you'll evenly divide this lava cake
batter into your prepared ramekins you
can just use a spoon but I found that
using an ice cream scoop makes the
process a lot cleaner now I've placed my
ramekins on a baking sheet it's just
going to make transferring them in and
out of the oven a little easier we'll
bake these chocolate lava cakes in our
450 degrees Fahrenheit preheated oven
for about 8 to 10 minutes now the best
way to know that your chocolate lava
cakes are finished baking is the
center's should be still looking
slightly under baked they should look a
little liquidy but if you jiggle them
the center should be firm they can move
a little bit but they shouldn't be pure
liquid you do not want to over bake
these lava cakes or they are going to
end up with no lava in the center within
5 minutes of your lava cakes coming out
of the oven you're going to want to run
a knife around the outside of the lava
cake just to loosen it from the ramekin
let these lava cakes cool for about 5
minutes before inverting them onto the
plate that you plan on serving them 1
keep in mind that the ramekins are still
going to be hot they came out of the
oven less than 10 minutes ago so always
use an oven mitt or some other
precaution when touching the ramekins
you want to enjoy these lava cakes while
they're still warm
now you can top these with whatever
you'd like I love using vanilla ice
cream or homemade whipped cream today
I'm just tapping mine with a little
dusting of powdered sugar these lava
cakes are so rich and delicious and I
can't wait to dig into this one I hope
you guys enjoyed today's lava cake
recipe if you did please leave me a
comment I always love hearing from you
thank you so much for watching and I'll
see you next time if you guys enjoyed
today's lava cake video I really hope
you will give me a thumbs up and please
subscribe if you enjoyed this video
today here are a few others you might
like as well
